channel.title: [Extremely Good Website] EclipseRuins (Upcoming Server) | Need Java Developer
channel.description:
I'm starting up a server, 317 Project Instanity. I have a base source with Netty, No deadlock, all dupes fixed, bugs/glitches fixed, perfect combat, etc. Very clean base with nothing added yet.
I can handle everything website sided, I need a Java Developer to work alongside with. After VPS and Website expenses are paid, and advertising.. Profits are split 50/50, no exceptions. The workload will be equal, so the profits will be split equal. I have a good server set up. I'm looking to set up two worlds, pking and economy, and have them connect together flawlessly. I have all of the code for setting up sockets also, for an easy connection between the game servers and website.
I am looking to have the server and site heavily integrated, using a PHP/Java bridge, sockets, and a separate SQL server. If you're interested, check out my contact information below.
Here is the current (already purchased) setup for our servers.
World 1 - Gameserver 1v (gs1) Operating System: Windows Server 2008 R2 Standard (64-bit) Installed RAM: 10gb Hard Drive Size: 100gb
World 2 - Gameserver 2 (gs2) Operating System: Windows Server 2008 R2 Standard (64-bit) Installed RAM: 10gb Hard Drive Size: 100gb
Database Server - MySQL (sql) Operating System: Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard - SQL Server 2014 Installed RAM: 2gb (This should be more than enough for a database server) Hard Drive Size: 40gb (This should be enough for the database information)
Web and File Server - CentOs (main) Operating System: CentOS 5 w/ MySQL (backed up from SQL server) Installed RAM: 2gb (This is enough to run a website, with ease) Hard Drive Space: 60gb (This should hold all the website files, just fine)
I may install a separate file server for sharing files between developers and players. Here is a picture of our servers. [img]http://i.imgur.com/Vc6siO5.png[/img]
If you're interested, and you're a good Java developer, contact me:
Moparscape: Just shoot me a PM or post in this thread. Skype: aj.cordio Email: ajcordio@live.com

item.title: [Extremely Good Website] EclipseRuins (Upcoming Server) | Need Java Developer
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Death Style, post:17, topic:544204”][quote author=Terraforming link=topic=663086.msg4433292#msg4433292 date=1404206365]

why would you use sockets to connect the game servers to the website

:palm:

So it can send data over. Not sure if this is secure, but works good.

I’m done

Same :palm:
http://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/doc/websocket.htm
[/quote]
m8 did you even read that

In the traditional request-response model used in HTTP, the client requests resources, and the server provides responses. The exchange is always initiated by the client; the server cannot send any data without the client requesting it first. This model worked well for the World Wide Web when clients made occasional requests for documents that changed infrequently, but the limitations of this approach are increasingly relevant as content changes quickly and users expect a more interactive experience on the Web. The WebSocket protocol addresses these limitations by providing a full-duplex communication channel between the client and the server.

jw why not http. is website generating some real time data you need to persistently fetch on game server? lost[/quote]

For now the only thing I’m using sockets for is sending server announcements in-game. So that administrators/the owner doesn’t have to log in to send announcements to players.

Read full topic
item.source: [Extremely Good Website] EclipseRuins (Upcoming Server) | Need Java Developer

m8 did you even read that

In the traditional request-response model used in HTTP, the client requests resources, and the server provides responses. The exchange is always initiated by the client; the server cannot send any data without the client requesting it first. This model worked well for the World Wide Web when clients made occasional requests for documents that changed infrequently, but the limitations of this approach are increasingly relevant as content changes quickly and users expect a more interactive experience on the Web. The WebSocket protocol addresses these limitations by providing a full-duplex communication channel between the client and the server.
jw why not http. is website generating some real time data you need to persistently fetch on game server? lost

item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:9, topic:544204”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=663086.msg4433096#msg4433096 date=1404154123]
Extremely good website? Surely someone thinks highly of themselves
[/quote]

Extremely good website? Surely someone thinks highly of themselves

Php duhh

I do professional website development, I have the right to think highly of myself. If you guys don’t have anything to contribute, stop being faggots.[/quote]
Very professional.

Death Style:

why would you use sockets to connect the game servers to the website

He’s not connecting the game server to the website. His server is listening (and maybe sending) data and just happened to use PHP to send data with. If he wanted he could create another client to do this.

item.title: [Extremely Good Website] EclipseRuins (Upcoming Server) | Need Java Developer
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I’m starting up a server, 317 Project Instanity. I have a base source with Netty, No deadlock, all dupes fixed, bugs/glitches fixed, perfect combat, etc. Very clean base with nothing added yet.

I can handle everything website sided, I need a Java Developer to work alongside with. After VPS and Website expenses are paid, and advertising… Profits are split 50/50, no exceptions. The workload will be equal, so the profits will be split equal. I have a good server set up. I’m looking to set up two worlds, pking and economy, and have them connect together flawlessly. I have all of the code for setting up sockets also, for an easy connection between the game servers and website.

I am looking to have the server and site heavily integrated, using a PHP/Java bridge, sockets, and a separate SQL server. If you’re interested, check out my contact information below.

Here is the current (already purchased) setup for our servers.

World 1 - Gameserver 1v (gs1)
Operating System: Windows Server 2008 R2 Standard (64-bit)
Installed RAM: 10gb
Hard Drive Size: 100gb

World 2 - Gameserver 2 (gs2)
Operating System: Windows Server 2008 R2 Standard (64-bit)
Installed RAM: 10gb
Hard Drive Size: 100gb

Database Server - MySQL (sql)
Operating System: Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard - SQL Server 2014
Installed RAM: 2gb (This should be more than enough for a database server)
Hard Drive Size: 40gb (This should be enough for the database information)

Web and File Server - CentOs (main)
Operating System: CentOS 5 w/ MySQL (backed up from SQL server)
Installed RAM: 2gb (This is enough to run a website, with ease)
Hard Drive Space: 60gb (This should hold all the website files, just fine)

I may install a separate file server for sharing files between developers and players. Here is a picture of our servers.

If you’re interested, and you’re a good Java developer, contact me:

Moparscape: Just shoot me a PM or post in this thread.
Skype: aj.cordio
Email: ajcordio@live.com
